creator: Luc.Minnebo.LM@Belgium.Agfa.com
text:
When using the property "alignment-baseline", the value "top" is rejected as 
invalid by the Batik svg viewer.

Test code :

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 1.0//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-
SVG-20010904/DTD/svg10.dtd">

<svg height="150" width="200">
  <g transform="translate(20,20)">

    <text y="20" style="font-size:40;fill:green">
	The 
	<tspan style="alignment-baseline:baseline;fill:green;font-size:20">
	  baseline
	</tspan>
    </text>

    <text y="60" style="font-size:40;fill:green">
	The 
	<tspan style="alignment-baseline:middle;fill:green;font-size:20">
	  middle
	</tspan>
    </text>

    <text y="100" style="font-size:40;fill:green">
	The 
	<tspan style="alignment-baseline:top;fill:green;font-size:20">
	  top
	</tspan>
    </text>
  </g>
</svg>

Value "top" is not a legitimate value for the alignment-baseline property. See
the SVG specification (section 10.9.2):

'alignment-baseline'
Value: auto | baseline | before-edge | text-before-edge | middle | central |
after-edge | text-after-edge |
ideographic | alphabetic | hanging | mathematical | inherit
Initial: auto
Applies to: 'tspan', 'tref', 'altGlyph', 'textPath' elements
Inherited: no
Percentages: N/A
Media: visual
Animatable: yes
